article_title: Parkway motorcycle crash closes lanes on Driscoll Bridge
article_text:
UPDATE: Police said all lanes have been reopened.

SAYREVILLE — All the southbound lanes to the Driscoll Bridge on the Garden State Parkway have been closed temporarily as a helicopter lands to transport individuals involved in a serious motor vehicle accident this evening, police said.

New Jersey State Police Sgt. Marc Roser said two motorcycles and a car were involved in the crash around 7:42 p.m. tonight.

Roser said the drivers of both motorcycles were being transported by helicopter for medical treatment. He said the extent of their injuries were not yet known.

The northbound lanes on the bridge remain open, Roser said. He said the southbound lanes would reopen once the helicopter clears.

He said of the cause of the crash remains under investigation.
